message.content:
cs.CV, cs.HC, cs.IR, cs.MM, cs.LG

Reasoning: The paper describes the development of a stool detection and tracking system using computer vision and deep convolutional neural networks (CNN). This suggests that the paper is likely to belong to the computer vision (cs.CV) sub-category. Additionally, the system is intended for use by patients, providers, and researchers in the assessment of chronic gastrointestinal (GI) disease, which suggests that the paper may also belong to the human-computer interaction (cs.HC) sub-category. The paper also involves the use of information retrieval techniques to analyze bowel diaries, which suggests that it may belong to the information retrieval (cs.IR) sub-category. The use of deep learning techniques for image analysis suggests that the paper may also belong to the multimedia (cs.MM) sub-category. Finally, the use of deep learning techniques for classification and recognition suggests that the paper may also belong to the machine learning (cs.LG) sub-category.
